Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Madam \Mad"am\, n.; pl. {Madams}, or {Mesdames}. [See {Madame}.] 1. A gentlewoman; -- an appellation or courteous form of address given to a lady, especially an elderly or a married lady; -- much used in the address, at the beginning of a letter, to a woman. The corresponding word in addressing a man is {Sir}; often abbreviated ma'am when used as a term of address. [1913 Webster]
2. The woman who is in charge of a household. [PJC]
3. The woman who is in charge of a brothel. [PJC]

madam n 1: a woman of refinement; "a chauffeur opened the door of the limousine for the grand lady" [syn: {dame}, {ma'am}, {lady}, {gentlewoman}] 2: a woman who runs a house of prostitution [syn: {brothel keeper}]
